page.title: 01DALRY - INTRODUCTION
page.content: Dalry, with just over 5000 people, is located in the Garnock Valley. 19th Century iron mining led to the growth of an industrial community within a farming area and the slag heaps remain a feature of the landscape. Many Dalry men worked in the nearby Glengarnock steelworks till they closed, leaving a major unemployment problem in the Valley.Ryeside Mills, previously employing women making ladies'clothes, has also closed. The major employer in the town is Roche Chemicals,a Swiss company making pharmaceuticals, including Vitamin C. Many Dalry people travel to Irvine New Town, Hunterston or Glasgow to work.It is a close-knit community with many organisations, but with close ties with neighbouring towns.The surrounding farmland is used mainly for traditional dairying and stockrearing.
